extension.searchTitle: IMPROVING BROADBAND ACCESS FOR VETERANS ACT OF 2016; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 175

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Improving Broadband Access for Veterans Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 6394, to require the Federal Communications Commission to submit to Congress a report on promoting broadband Internet access service for veterans, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 411 yeas to 4 nays, Roll No. 604;

titleInfo.title: EXPRESSING SENSE OF HOUSE THAT ACCESS TO DIGITAL COMMUNICATIONS TOOLS AND CONNECTIVITY IS NECESSARY TO PREPARE YOUTH

extension.searchTitle: EXPRESSING SENSE OF HOUSE THAT ACCESS TO DIGITAL COMMUNICATIONS TOOLS AND CONNECTIVITY IS NECESSARY TO PREPARE YOUTH; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 175

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that access to digital communications tools and connectivity is necessary to prepare youth in the United States to compete in the 21st century economy
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H. Res. 939, expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that access to digital communications tools and connectivity is necessary to prepare youth in the United States to compete in the 21st century economy, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 411 yeas to 1 nay, Roll No. 605;

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the bill was passed.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Jeff Miller and Richard Blumenthal Veterans Health Care and Benefits Improvement Act of 2016
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and pass the following measures:<P/>H.R. 6416, to amend title 38, United States Code, to make certain improvements in the laws administered by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 419 yeas with none voting ``nay'', Roll No. 606;
